citation.article-title: Taxonomy of the family Halobacteriaceae and the description of two new genera Halorubrobacterium and Natrialba.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Halorubrobacterium (Hal.o.rub.ro.bac.te'ri.um. Gr, n. halo, halos, the sea, salt; L. adj. ruber, red; Gr. n. bakterion, a small rod; M. L. neut. n. Halorubrobacterium, red-colored salt bacterium)
Colonies are round, smooth, forming a red-pink, non-diffusible pigment.
Growth occurs in media containing between 1.5 M to saturated (5.3 M) NaCl, at a temperature range of 4-56°C.
Isolated from hypersaline habitats (salt ponds, salterns).
The G + C content of the DNA is 65.3-71.2 mol% (buoyant density method).
